title: How to Make Taro in Coconut Cream and Honey

steps.headline: Using a peeler, peel off the outer covering of four individual tubers of taro.
steps.description: Wash the taro to remove all traces of dirt.

steps.headline: Cut the peeled and washed taro into halves.
Place the pieces of taro in a saucepan of boiling water.
steps.description: Boil the taro until the soft.

steps.headline: Drain.
steps.description: Once the taro is ready, drain out the water and put the taro in a bowl whilst you work on making the coconut and honey cream.

parts.name: Making the coconut and honey cream

steps.headline: Crack open two coconuts in halves.
steps.description: Scrape out the juicy white flesh and place it into a bowl. Do not add water to the scrapings.

steps.headline: Place a handful of scraped coconut flesh into a mesh bag.
steps.description: Twist the edges in opposite directions so that the juices can be squeezed out. Extract as much coconut cream from the scrapings as you can.

steps.headline: Transfer the coconut cream to a small pot.
steps.description: Put it on the stove at lower heat.

steps.headline: Heat the coconut cream up slowly until you see it bubbling.
steps.description: At this point, add 3 to 4 tablespoons of honey.

steps.headline: Continue to stir the mixture until it thickens.
steps.description: Remove the cream from the heat once thickened.

parts.name: Serving the taro in coconut and honey cream

steps.headline: Pour the cooked coconut and honey cream all over the taro.
steps.description: Mix gently to ensure that all surfaces of the taro have been coated in the cream.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: To complete the presentation of the taro in coconut and honey cream, grate a handful of chopped shallots and sprinkle them over the surface of the taro. Serve immediately.

text: Preparing the taro Using a peeler, peel off the outer covering of four individual tubers of taro. Wash the taro to remove all traces of dirt. Cut the peeled and washed taro into halves.  Place the pieces of taro in a saucepan of boiling water. Boil the taro until the soft. Drain. Once the taro is ready, drain out the water and put the taro in a bowl whilst you work on making the coconut and honey cream. Making the coconut and honey cream Crack open two coconuts in halves. Scrape out the juicy white flesh and place it into a bowl. Do not add water to the scrapings. Place a handful of scraped coconut flesh into a mesh bag. Twist the edges in opposite directions so that the juices can be squeezed out. Extract as much coconut cream from the scrapings as you can. Transfer the coconut cream to a small pot. Put it on the stove at lower heat. Heat the coconut cream up slowly until you see it bubbling. At this point, add 3 to 4 tablespoons of honey. Continue to stir the mixture until it thickens. Remove the cream from the heat once thickened. Serving the taro in coconut and honey cream Pour the cooked coconut and honey cream all over the taro. Mix gently to ensure that all surfaces of the taro have been coated in the cream. Serve. To complete the presentation of the taro in coconut and honey cream, grate a handful of chopped shallots and sprinkle them over the surface of the taro. Serve immediately.
